unit_learning_outcomes.description: Apply appropriate strategic performance measurement techniques in evaluating and improving organisational performance.
Use strategic planning and control models to plan and monitor organisational performance.
Apply skills to assess the impact of risk and uncertainty on organisational performance.

Identify and evaluate the design features of effective performance management information and monitoring systems, and recognise the impact of developments in technology on performance measurement and management systems.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are required to read the relevant materials from the textbook to prepare well for the weekly classes. The workbooks contain additional in depth reading for the key topics along with exam technique skills
